data.name: backToHoops
data.value: Back to hoops

data.name: BothGripBallStoppageAnswer2
data.value: Both players stay in position but cannot fight for the ball during broom's down

data.name: BothGripBallStoppageAnswer1
data.value: Both players must release the ball to the ground, then can restart attacking it on broom's up

data.name: BothGripBallStoppageAnswer3
data.value: Both players must release the ball to the ground while broom's down, but can grab it again before broom's up.

data.name: BothGripBallStoppageAnswer4
data.value: Both players stay in position during broom's down and can try to get a better gripping on the ball before broom's up.

data.name: BothGripBallStoppageExplanation
data.value: It's a good idea to have an assistant watch the situation during broom's down.

data.name: BlueCard
data.value: Blue card

data.name: NoPenalty

data.value: The team must change as few players as possible

data.name: QuestionDecliningCatchAnswer1
data.value: A team may decline any snitch catch

data.name: QuestionDecliningCatchAnswer2
data.value: The catch can be just after a goal and before the referee confirmed the goal as good

data.name: QuestionDecliningCatchAnswer3
data.value: The catch occured after a goal event (good or otherwise), and before the referee adjust his call for this event

data.name: QuestionDecliningCatchAnswer4
data.value: The change in score must change whether the catch would end the period in a tie

data.name: QuestionDecliningCatchText
data.value: What of the following are true for a team that wants to decline a snitch catch ?

data.name: QuestionDefBlueCardsAnswer1
data.value: A second blue card is upgraded to a yellow card

data.name: QuestionDefBlueCardsAnswer2
data.value: Any ball acted upon or prevented to get by the fouling player is turned over

data.name: QuestionDefBlueCardsAnswer3
data.value: Quaffle is turned over

data.name: QuestionDefBlueCardsAnswer4
data.value: Player is released after a minute

data.name: QuestionDefBlueCardsAnswer5
data.value: Player is released after getting scored

data.name: QuestionDefRedCardsAnswer1
data.value: Any ball acted upon or prevented to get by the fouling player is turned over

data.name: QuestionDefRedCardsAnswer2
data.value: Quaffle is turned over

data.name: QuestionDefRedCardsAnswer3
data.value: A Player is released after a minute

data.name: QuestionDefRedCardsAnswer4
data.value: A Player is released after two minutes

data.name: QuestionDefRedCardsAnswer5
data.value: A Player is released after getting scored

data.name: QuestionDefRedCardsExplanation
data.value: Since the red carded player may not play the match again, it is a different player that must go into the penalty box and be released.

data.name: QuestionStandardContactPenaltyAnswer1
data.value: This penalty may be reduced

data.name: QuestionStandardContactPenaltyAnswer2
data.value: This penalty may be augmented

data.name: QuestionStandardContactPenaltyExplanation
data.value: The penalty shall be reduced to a back to hoops if the fouling player immediatly correct his position, and augmented to a red card if the play was egregious.

data.value: Repeat procedure

data.value: A substitution violation is defined as an illegal substitution that did not affect play yet.

data.name: QuestionSubstitutionViolationText
data.value: What is the penalty for a substitution violation ?

data.name: QuestionTeamPenaltyAnswer1
data.value: The team must play with fewer than the necessary amount of player

data.name: QuestionTeamPenaltyAnswer2
data.value: The team must forfeit

data.name: QuestionTeamPenaltyExplanation
data.value: This is also true if the team has more than 7 players, but cannot respect the 4-maximum rule.

data.name: QuestionTeamPenaltyText
data.value: What happens when a team falls below the necessary number of player during a game ?

data.name: QuestionThirdBludgerInterferenceAnswer1
data.value: Double bludger turnover

data.name: QuestionThirdBludgerInterferenceText

data.value: The ball is placed at the hoops of the fouled team

data.value: The ball is unplayable until the fouled team plays it

data.value: The turnover is cancelled

data.value: The player must sub and correct his equipment before entering play

data.name: QuestionUseIllegalEquipmentText

data.name: QuestionUseSpecificalIllegalEquipmentAnswer1
data.value: The player must sub and correct his equipment before entering play

data.name: QuestionUseSpecificalIllegalEquipmentText
data.value: What is the penalty for using an equipment that was specified as illegal by the tournament organisator ?

data.name: QuestionViolentContactText

data.name: QuestionViolentKickText
data.value: What is the penalty for a violent or egregious kick ?

data.name: QuestionYellowDuringAdvantageAnswer1
data.value: The player goes to the penalty box

data.name: QuestionYellowDuringAdvantageAnswer2
data.value: The player must go back to hoops

data.name: QuestionYellowDuringAdvantageAnswer3
data.value: The player keeps playing

data.name: QuestionYellowDuringAdvantageExplanation
data.value: Since the foul happened before the score, it would have released the player. In this case, the player is not sent to the penalty box and keeps playing.

data.name: QuestionYellowDuringAdvantageText
data.value: A player do a blue or yellow card offense causing an advantage. After the fouled team scores, the referee gives the card to the player.

data.name: RedCard
data.value: Red card

data.name: Turnover
data.value: Turnover

data.name: YellowCard
data.value: Yellow card

data.name: QuestionTeamCompositionText
data.value: What is the lower and upper limit of the number of player in a team ?

data.name: QuestionThirdBludgerInterferenceExplanation
data.value: One of the turned over bludger should usually be the one that was on the ground.

data.name: QuestionInboundingProcedureViolationExplanation
data.value: If an incoming beater was faulty but was retrieving the third bludger,

data.name: QuestionInboundingProcedureViolationText
data.value: What is the penalty for an inbounding procedure violation ?

data.name: QuestionEncroachingPitchText
data.value: What is the penalty for encroaching the pitch ?

data.name: QuestionGifTestQuestionText
data.value: This is a placeholder for this question's text. If you find the answer, congrats.

data.name: BeaterResetCrossBothLinesExplanation
data.value: A player crossing two lines in a single run is considered having used only one reset.

data.name: BeaterResetReturnsExplanation
data.value: A player menaced by an opposing beater may cross the midline without it being an illegal reset, but still use a reset for his team.

data.name: PhysicalResetReturnsFastExplanation
data.value: A player physically forced behind the midfield line does not use its team's reset, under the condition that he or she makes the Quaffle cross the line back as soon as reasonnably possible.

data.name: PhysicalResetReturnsMediumFastExplanation
data.value: A player physically forced behind the midfield line does not use its team's reset, under the condition that he or she makes the Quaffle cross the line back as soon as reasonnably possible.

data.name: PhysicalResetReturnsSlowExplanation
data.value: A player physically forced behind the midfield line does not use its team's reset, under the condition that he or she makes the Quaffle cross the line back as soon as reasonnably possible. Here, the player is taking its time, forcing a reset used call.

data.name: QuestionQuaffleCarrier
data.value: What is the penalty for the Quaffle Carrier?

data.name: QuestionQuaffleCarriers
data.value: What is the penalty for the quaffle carries team?

data.name: QuestionResetRandom
data.value: What is the penalty for the Quaffle Carrier? (We assume they are not aware of who is behind them)

data.name: ResetAfterGetBack
data.value: What is the penalty for the player who just passed to his keeper?

data.name: ResetAfterGetBackExplanation
data.value: The player who initiates a drive may carry or propel the quaffle backward across one or both restrictor lines immediately upon the beginning of the drive without it counting as a reset.

data.name: ResetAtBeatExplanation
data.value: A player has to be there when the ball arrives for the pass to be considered valid, regardless of the state of the player at the beginning of the pass.

data.name: ResetAtRandomNoneExplanation
data.value: A player throwing behind crossing a reset line, or further into his own half, without anyone to receive perpetrates an illegal reset.

data.name: ResetAtRandomSomeoneExplanation
data.value: A player throwing behind crossing a reset line, or further into his own half, without knowing if anyone is here to receive perpetrates an illegal reset. Carefull not to penalize a player that knows where their teammates are without having to look.

data.name: ResetBothWhilePassingExplanation
data.value: The pass during the run back creates two separate reset actions, which triggers the illegal reset.

data.name: ResetDeadQuaffle
data.value: What is the penalty for the player who kicked the Quaffle?

data.name: ResetDeadQuaffleExplanation
data.value: A loose quaffle does not require a receiver to be reset.

data.name: ResetOpponentJerkBallExplanation
data.value: An opposing player jerking the Quaffle behind a reset line does not trigger the reset used, as long as the driving team makes it go back as soon as possible.

data.name: ResetThrowBothLineExplanation
data.value: A player passing across two lines is considered having used only one reset, as it is a single action.

data.name: ResetUsed
data.value: Reset Used

data.name: BeaterCommit3rdInterference
data.value: The beater who threw the bludger commited a third bludger interference.

data.name: ChargeAfterClaimAnswer1
data.value: The beater that claimed immunity should be penalized

data.name: ChargeAfterClaimExplanation
data.value: It is forbidden to take any other action than retrieving the bludger when claiming immunity.

data.name: Claim2DeadAnswer1
data.value: Blue player's claim of immunity is invalid, he should be send back to hoops

data.name: Claim2DeadAnswer2
data.value: Blue player's claim of immunity is valid

data.name: Claim2DeadAnswer3
data.value: Blue player's claim of immunity is invalid, he should be given a blue card

data.name: Claim2DeadExplanation
data.value: Blue player cannot claim immunity while 2 bludgers are dead. However, since the claim did not affect the game yet, the penalty is reduced to a minor invalid immunity claim.

data.name: ClaimAfterDeadExplanation
data.value: Here the claim is done right as the bludger hits the ground, becoming dead. Thus the claim is valid.

data.name: ClaimAfterLeaveHandExplanation
data.value: A claim made when a bludger is live does not make the player immune to that bludger.

data.name: ClaimBeforeLeaveHandExplanation
data.value: A claim made before the opposing beater made the bludger live is valid, even if that player already started the movement.

data.name: ClaimerIsBeat1
data.value: Beater that claimed immunity is beat

data.name: ClaimerIsBeat2
data.value: Beater that claimed immunity is immune

data.name: ClaimStillLiveAnswer1
data.value: Blue beater claim is valid and he can keep playing.

data.name: ClaimStillLiveAnswer2
data.value: Blue beater committed an improper immunity claim and must be sent back to hoops.

data.name: ClaimStillLiveExplanation
data.value: Claiming immunity while the third bludger is still live results in an improper immunity claim.

data.name: ImmunityShootHoopsAnswer1
data.value: The kick is valid, no penalty

data.name: ImmunityShootHoopsAnswer2
data.value: The kick is invalid, yellow player should be penalized

data.name: ImmunityShootHoopsExplanation
data.value: Kicking to the player's hoops is a valid way of retrieving the bludger

data.name: OneClaimOtherGetAnswer1
data.value: Blue beater that raised is fist should be penalized

data.name: OneClaimOtherGetAnswer2
data.value: Blue beater that got the ball should be penalized

data.name: OneClaimOtherGetAnswer3
data.value: Both blue beaters should be penalized

data.name: OneClaimOtherGetExplanation
data.value: Nothing prevents the beater that did not claimed immunity to get the third bludger.

data.name: PackBludgersAnswer1
data.value: The beater gathering the bludgers commits a foul by getting the 2sd bludger

data.name: PackBludgersAnswer2
data.value: The beater gathering the bludgers commits a foul by getting the 3rd bludger

data.name: PackBludgersAnswer3
data.value: The beater gathering the bludgers commits no foul

data.name: PackBludgersExplanation
data.value: As there was always 2 dead bludgers at the same time, there can be no 3rd bludger interference.

data.name: QuestionWhatIsTrue
data.value: Which of the followings are true?

data.name: ShootAfterBeatAnswer1
data.value: The kick was valid, no penalty.

data.name: ShootAfterBeatAnswer2
data.value: The kick was valid and blue is KO, but yellow player should be penalized

data.name: ShootAfterBeatAnswer3
data.value: The kick was not valid, yellow player should be penalized

data.name: ShootAfterBeatExplanation
data.value: Shooting the bludger is a valid way of retrieving it, so no penalty should be issued here.

data.name: ShootImmuneBeaterAnswer1
data.value: Blue beater is still immune and may retrieve the bludger

data.name: ShootImmuneBeaterAnswer2
data.value: Blue beater is not immune anymore but not KO

data.name: ShootImmuneBeaterExplanation
data.value: Nothing in the rules prevent a player from trying to beat another immune player, as long as this does not transgress another rule.

data.name: ThrowBackGet3rdAnswer1
data.value: No penalty for blue player

data.name: ThrowBackGet3rdAnswer2
data.value: The beater is still immune

data.name: ThrowBackGet3rdExplanation
data.value: Taking the third bludger without having used its own bludger in a valid way is a 3rd bludger interference

data.name: ThrowToImmuneGetExplanation
data.value: Taking the third bludger without having used its own bludger in a valid way is a 3rd bludger interference

data.name: TwoClaim1LowerAnswer1
data.value: Claim is valid, no penalty.

data.name: TwoClaim1LowerAnswer2
data.value: One blue player should be penalized

data.name: TwoClaim1LowerAnswer3
data.value: Both blue players should be penalized

data.name: TwoClaim1LowerExplanation
data.value: When both beaters in a team claim immunity, one must lower his fist immediatly to avoid a penalty.

data.name: TwoClaimAnswer1
data.value: Claim is valid, no penalty.

data.name: TwoClaimAnswer2
data.value: One blue beater should be penalized

data.name: TwoClaimAnswer3
data.value: Both blue beaters should be penalized

data.name: TwoClaimExplanation
data.value: If no beater immediatly lowers his fist, one beater commits a minor invalid immunity claim and should be send back to hoops

data.name: ContactBothJump
data.value: What of the followings are true (If unspecified, for the quaffle carrier)

data.name: ContactBothJumpAnswer1
data.value: Defending player should receive the same penalty

data.name: ContactBothJumpExplanation
data.value: While this could be considered a charge (illegal in the air), the intent of the player is also important. here players don't play the opponent's body, as a charge would, but instead jump for the goal.

data.name: ContactBeforeBallAnswer1
data.value: Reset and redo the boom's up

data.name: ContactBeforeBallAnswer2
data.value: Blue player should be penalized

data.name: ContactBeforeBallAnswer3
data.value: White player should be penalized

data.name: ContactBeforeBallExplanation
data.value: Here you can see white player going for the quaffle, while blue player instead go first for the player, then for the quffle after the contact. An incidental charge as both players went for the quaffle would have been ok, but that is not the case here.

data.name: QuestionMultiplePlayersInBoxWhenScoreAnswer3
data.value: The team chooses who gets released first

data.name: BBNoBallExplanation
data.value: Body blocking that way is legal even without a ball involved. Carefull, a body block has force applied AFTER contact is initiated, not before.

data.name: BeatOutsideField1Explanation
data.value: Once outside the pitch, green player becomes immune. Yellow player is willingly throwing a ball with the intention of sending it out of pitch, which is illegal. (Blue card)

data.name: BeatOutsideField2Explanation
data.value: A feet outside is enough for green player to become immune. Consequently, Yellow player is willingly throwing a ball with the intention of sending it out of pitch, which is illegal. (Blue card)

data.name: BeatOutsideField3Explanation
data.value: The green player does not become immune until she reaches outside the field.

data.name: BludgerPriority1Explanation
data.value: Yellow player is closest when the bludger goes out, so she gets priority.

data.name: BludgerPriority2Explanation
data.value: While yellow player is closest when the bludger goes out, she is not elligible because she already own a bludger. The next closest player is green, so she can retrieve the bludger thrown.

data.name: BludgerPriority3Explanation
data.value: As green is the closest elligible player when the bludger goes out, she is the one who can retrieve the bludger at the start. However, after the beat, the next closest elligible player become the yellow player.

data.name: ChargeNoBallExplanation
data.value: Yellow player already has force as the contact begin, qualifying this contact for a charge. Charges are illegal without a ball involved.

data.name: Clip1
data.value: Clip 1

data.name: Clip2
data.value: Clip 2

data.name: FistDownStillImuneExplanation
data.value: Even when the player lowers its fist, they stay immune until they retrieve the bludger.

data.name: GreenIsBeat
data.value: Green player is beat.

data.name: GreenPlayerRetrieveBludger
data.value: Green player should retrieve the bludger

data.name: GreenPlayerRetrieveQuaffle
data.value: The green player should retrieve the quaffle

data.name: InboundingBludger
data.value: Which way is correct to inbound a bludger?

data.name: InboundingBludgerExplanation
data.value: A bludger has to be inbounded to the closest point from where you retrieve it.

data.name: InboundingBludgerThrowExplanation
data.value: Caution: if the opposing team controls two bludgers, this bludger cannot be turned over. Only apply the back to hoops penalty in this case.

data.name: InboundingQuaffle
data.value: Which way is correct to inbound a quaffle?

data.name: InboundingQuaffleExplanation
data.value: A quaffle has to be inbounded to the point where it left the field.

data.name: InboundingQuaffleThrowExplanation
data.value: The quaffle cannot be thrown in. Also, the player has 5 seconds to inbound any ball.

data.name: InboundingSteppedOutExplanation
data.value: While the player did not went in exactly where the official requested him to, the difference is not significant enough to warrant a penalty.

data.name: KeeperBeatFeetInAnswer1
data.value: Keeper is beat

data.name: KeeperBeatFeetInAnswer2
data.value: Beater who threw the bluger should be penalized

data.name: KeeperBeatFeetInAnswer3
data.value: Keeper is not beat

data.name: KeeperBeatFeetInAnswer4
data.value: Keeper should be penalized

data.name: KeeperBeatFeetInExplanation
data.value: While the keeper is mostly out of his zone when hit, his feet is still in, so she is still protected.

data.name: KeeperOutStoledExplanation
data.value: The keeper stopped being protected once out of the zone, and cannot become protected again until the opposing team controls the quaffle.

data.name: KickHandCloseExplanation
data.value: While green player's hand was close, yellow player hit the ball before it was touching the ball.

data.name: KickHandOnBallExplanation
data.value: Green player had her hand on the ball, thus making the kick illegal.

data.name: KickHandRemovedExplanation
data.value: Green player had to remove her hand to not get kicked, making it an illegal kick.

data.name: KickRestrainedExplanation
data.value: While yellow player kicks the ball as green player touched it, the kick was severely restrained when yellow player realized it would be an illegal kick. In this case, use no harm no foul.

data.name: KOProcessNotFollowed1
data.value: The KO procedure requires the player to remove their broom, touch the hoop then remount their broom. Note that affecting play after a wrong procedure would have been a yellow card.

data.name: KOProcessNotFollowed2
data.value: While the player start to remove its broom, the brooms does not leave their legs completely. The procedure is not correct. This is important during games where beater will want to gain time after being beat near a hoop.

data.name: No
data.value: No

data.name: PenaltyGreenPlayer
data.value: What penalty should green player receive?

data.name: PenaltyYellowPlayer
data.value: What penalty should yellow player receive?

data.name: PushNoBallExplanation
data.value: Push a player that way is legal even without a ball involed. Carefull, a push should not involve excessive force or force before the contact.

data.name: QuafflePriority1Explanation
data.value: For the quaffle, except some specific cases, the team that can retrieve the quaffle is always the team that did not threw it outside.

data.name: QuestionWhatIsTrueSteppedout
data.value: Assuming the player went in a bit farther than the official indicated, which of the following is true?

data.name: RepeatProcedure
data.value: Repeat the procedure

data.name: RequestInZoneExplanation
data.value: After the ball was passed as the keeper requested, the keeper controls the quaffle inside his keeper zone, game can proceed.

data.name: RequestOutZoneExplanation
data.value: Since the ball was touched by another player or official after the goal, the keeper needs to get back into his keeper zone before proceeding with the game.

data.name: RestartBackToMidfieldExplanation
data.value: The keeper correctly goes back into her own half of the field. At this point, she's the first one that touched the ball after the goal and is in her own half, so she can start the attack.

data.name: RestartOpposingMidfieldExplanation
data.value: The keeper cannot restart from the opposing half of the field.

data.name: RestartOutOfZoneExplanation
data.value: Since no one touched the quaffle after the goal, the keeper can start the attack from her own half of the field.

data.name: SoleControlAnswer1
data.value: The keeper should get the quaffle, ending yellow's attack

data.name: SoleControlAnswer2
data.value: Play should keep going

data.name: SoleControlExplanation
data.value: The keeper must be the sole owner of the quaffle to be protected. Since yellow player is contesting it, play keeps going.

data.name: StealProtectedKeeperExplanation
data.value: It is illegal to steal a ball from a protected keeper.

data.name: YellowPenalized
data.value: Yellow player should be penalized

data.name: YellowPlayerRetrieveBludger
data.value: Yellow player should retrieve the bludger

data.name: YellowPlayerRetrieveQuaffle
data.value: The yellow player should retrieve the quaffle

data.name: Yes
data.value: Yes

data.name: CanKeeperRestart
data.value: Can the keeper start the attack?

data.name: ContactBeforeBall
data.value: What is the penalty for the blue player?
